intro: Cynometra luzoniensis, commonly known as the Luzon ironwood, is a deciduous tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Sterculiaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark bark and glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by woody, elongated fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland forests, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
